pullrequest.title: Add camera visibility mask and visual visibility flags

content.raw:
A question that came up while reviewing the related ign-gazebo PR. Why are we setting the default bitmask to 0xFFFF \(while it is a 32 bit value\)? It seems to communicate to the user that it is a 16 bit value while it isn’t.

I understand that a good argument in favor is consistency with the collide\_bitmask implementation but would just like to check whether there is any other reason, I could think of “keeping the upper 16 bits reserved” but I can’t see many usecases for it.
